meanings.definition: To shoot out in a stream or jet.
meanings.sent1: The water was jetting out of the hose.
meanings.sent2: The rocket was jetting into space at incredible speed.
meanings.sent3: The fountain was jetting water so high that it reached the top of the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her words were jetting out of her mouth before she could stop them.
meanings.sent5: The car was jetting down the highway, leaving a trail of dust behind.

meanings.sent1: They were jetting off to a tropical island for their vacation.
meanings.sent2: The business executives were jetting across the country for meetings.
meanings.sent3: The family was jetting to their reunion in style.
meanings.sent4: The team was jetting to the championship game in high spirits.
meanings.sent5: She was jetting to the conference to present her research findings.

meanings.definition: A narrow stream of liquid or gas forced out of a small opening.
meanings.sent1: The jetting of water from the fountain was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The jetting of steam from the kettle signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent3: The jetting of bubbles in the soda made it fizzy.
meanings.sent4: The jetting of air from the tire indicated a leak.
meanings.sent5: The jetting of fuel from the nozzle filled the tank quickly.
